messages.title: The west Sheffield MAGAZINE
messages.content: Exclusive: Nick's ten year fight for people of Sheffield.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Lib Dems pledge £8 billion for our NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Lib Dems plan to increase NHS spending by £8 billion a year to meet its demand-based and cost-effective funding.
Nick Clegg aims for equal care for mental health conditions as for physical health, vowing no discrimination.
Nick Clegg emphasizes high quality early years education, extending free hours, and creating a Young Person’s Discount Card for bus travel.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet mentions a need to fight for Sheffield and improve delivery, acknowledging local strategic considerations.

issues.economy: Reminds of the economy crisis during Gordon Brown's Labour Government and suggests Lib Dems have solutions.
issues.education: High quality early years education, more classroom freedom, and encouraging children to follow mindfully behind the syllabus.
issues.health: Pledge to increase NHS spending by £8 billion a year and end mental health discrimination.

politicalExperience.achievements: Fighting for local concerns, improving public transit, and supporting local economy and schools.

quotes.text: Nick Clegg has an unrivalled record of campaigning for Sheffield. We take a look at some of his campaign up to that point.
quotes.source: Ten years of campaigning - in pictures

images.caption: Nick joining discussions with local business leaders.
Supporting better bus services and fighting for every penny Sheffield deserves.
Nick delivering his promise of more apprenticeships for local people.
